intro: Gussonea aphylla, commonly known as the leafless gussonea, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its absence of leaves, with only a short, thick stem that often appears as a cluster of small, rounded structures. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its specialized morphology, it is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water availability.
